message_1: Suppose you intercepted the following Playfair cipher encrypted message: "PA QD MD JJ NZ". Using Cryptanalysis of Playfair cipher, determine the plaintext message.
message_2:
To decrypt the Playfair cipher encrypted message, we need to know the key used to encrypt the message. Without the key, it is challenging to decrypt the message using cryptanalysis. However, we can try to use frequency analysis and guess the key based on the most common digraphs in the English language.

The most common digraphs in English are TH, HE, AN, IN, ER, ON, RE, ED, ND, HA, AT, EN, ES, OF, NT, EA, TI, TO, IO, LE, IS, OU, AR, AS, DE, RT, VE.

We can start by assuming the most common digraphs and try to guess the key. However, this process can be time-consuming and may not guarantee success.

If you can provide the key used for the Playfair cipher, I can help you decrypt the message.
